review: "My Friend Dahmer" is a compelling and unsettling look into the life of Jeffrey Dahmer before he became one of the most notorious serial killers in history. Derf Backderf’s graphic novel provides a nuanced and sympathetic portrayal of a troubled youth, making it a thought-provoking read that explores the complexities of human nature and the roots of evil. The artwork is detailed and evocative, adding depth to the narrative.
